data.title: Barbara Robinson
data.meta_description: Barbara Robinson passed away. This is the full obituary where you can express condolences and share memories. Published in the Edmonton Journal on 2024-06-03.
data.text:
It is with sad hearts that the family of Barbara Yvonne Robinson, (n√©e Smith) announces her passing. Born on January 23, 1928, in Jackson, Michigan, she passed away on May 7, 2024, at her home in Edmonton, Alberta, at the age of 96.

Barbara spent her childhood in Ann Arbor, Michigan, where her lifelong interests in outdoor activities, music, and sports developed. After her graduation from high school, Barbara studied zoology at the University of Michigan. It was there that she met her future husband, Donald Baker Robinson, who was working on his PhD in chemical engineering. A few months after their marriage in 1948, they moved to Edmonton, Alberta, where Don served as a professor at the University of Alberta. Barbara embraced her new life in Edmonton where they made their new home and life together and raised their family.

Barbara pursued a diverse array of interests throughout her life. She found joy in the natural world, participating in activities such as backpacking, camping, canoeing, cross-country skiing, and birdwatching. Her love for adventure was demonstrated by her many travels to exciting destinations around the world. Barbara's zest for life was also evident in her love for social activities, including bridge, square dancing, curling, play-reading, and entertaining friends. In her later years, she remained intellectually curious, continuing to pursue her education and love of learning by taking courses at the University, and regularly engaging in activities such as reading and discussing scientific discoveries and current events with friends and family.

Barbara's dedication to learning and community engagement was inspiring. She served as one of the inaugural tour guides at the Provincial Museum and Archives, sharing her knowledge and passion for science, nature and Indigenous culture with countless school groups for many years. Later, alongside her husband, she contributed significantly to the success of DB Robinson and Associates Ltd., leaving an indelible mark on the company. In retirement, Barb and Don relocated to Oliver, BC, where they continued to enrich the community through their involvement with the Oliver Museum and Archives, establishing a state of the art archive facility. Through the years, Barbara and Donald encouraged and supported their children and grandchildren in their educational, musical, and athletic pursuits, a tradition Barbara extended to her great- grandchildren. Her impact on her community and family, and her commitment to lifelong learning will continue to inspire future generations.

Barbara will be deeply missed and fondly remembered by all whose lives she touched, particularly by her four daughters, Carol (Ronald) Smith, Anne Robinson (Kevin Timoney), Louise Robinson (Gregory Christensen), and Peggy (John) Maslen; her 13 grandchildren: Wilson, Casey, Robin, Leah, Carley, Maya, Linden, Arbour, Harley, Tyler, Alana, John (Jack), and Joseph; and her 24 great-grandchildren.

Barbara was predeceased by Donald, her loving husband of fifty years; her parents, Raymond and Lerna (Carley) Smith; her sister, Verna Mae Valley; her nephew, Bruce Valley; and three great-grandchildren, Madelyn, Spencer, and Maggie Navratil.

A celebration of Barbara's life will be held at St. Paul's United Church, 11526 76 Ave NW, Edmonton, AB at 2:00 p.m. on June 15, 2024. The service will be livestreamed. Please contact the church for a link to view it online.

In lieu of flowers, the family requests that memorial donations be made in Barbara's honour to any of the four DB Robinson Engineering funds at the University of Alberta. Go to uabgive.ca/tribute to make a gift online or send donations payable to the "University of Alberta" to the Office of the Recording Secretary | 3-501, 10230 Jasper Ave NW | Edmonton AB T5J 4P6, noting your donation is in memory of Mrs. Barbara Robinson. For any additional assistance please email giving@ualberta.ca.

A private graveside service was held on May 14, 2024, in Oliver, BC, where Barbara was laid to rest beside her husband, Donald. Burial arrangements were by Nunes-Pottinger Funeral Service & Crematorium.
